attributes.action: Bring back capital punishment for premeditated murder and treason
attributes.background: Those who plan to kill others should understand they will pay with their own lives if caught and found guilty. Those who seek to betray their country should likewise understand the consequences.

attributes.action: A residency qualification of 5 years to sufficient for full UK voting rights.
attributes.background: My Swedish wife has been here for 36 years and is barred from voting in GEs and referenda. This is an affront to any acceptable standard of democracy. She works and pays taxes here, and has had a National Insurance Number for many years. Sign if you can see that this is deeply undemocratic.
attributes.additional_details: It is simple. There should be no taxation without representation, and people who have shown their commitment to the UK for 5 years or more are, in my view, entitled to have a say in how the country is governed. Anything else is clearly unfair, undemocratic, and unacceptable.

attributes.action: Let the whole UK electorate vote for City mayors.
attributes.background: Cities are the most important hubs in any country, so the Mayor should be elected nationwide, by a wider electorate.

attributes.action: Recognise The Windrush Generation & make them all automatically British citizens
attributes.background: In 1948 hundreds from the Carribean answered the call from the motherland to help rebuild the UK. Many continued to arrive with their families until 1971 & under the 1948 national immigration act were automatically granted British citizenship. It's time to make all of that generation British.
attributes.additional_details: David Lammy called for recognition of the Windrush Generation & many more.

attributes.action: Referendum to join the EU on the 30th of March 2019
attributes.background:
The UK is leaving the EU on the 29th of March 2019. There will be no second referendum for leaving the EU. The applicant accepts this.

However, the applicant strongly believes that there should be a referendum for joining the EU again on the 30th of March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
The 2016 referendum was overshadowed by misinformation from both sides, scaremongering and possibly foreign interference. 

The voters did not fully understand what the EU is or the impact on their lives and the UK as a whole. 

This petition is no attempt to change the fact that the UK is leaving the EU.

However, and in the name of democracy, the voters should enjoy a referendum to decide if the UK should join the EU again after the 29th of March 2019.

For Queen & Country,

attributes.action: Require all fast food restaurants & coffee shops to use paper lids on drinks.
attributes.background: The UN has cofirmed that there is just 12 years left to reverse the damage done to our climate. Plastic is a huge contributing factor to the damage that has already taken place. Following paper straws, we need to introduce paper lids to reduce unnessecary plastic usage!
attributes.additional_details:
United Nations Report: http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

https://www.theloop.ca/we-only-have-12-years-left-to-fix-climate-change-before-were-totally-screwed/

How plastic is damaging the earth:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/environment/plastic-how-planet-earth-environment-oceans-wildlife-recycling-landfill-artificial-a7972226.html%3famp

BBC’s “Drowning in Plastic” documentes the damage that has occurred through plastic usage.

attributes.action: Use EU law to restrict immigration to people who support themselves or find work
attributes.background: EU laws, employed successfully in Belgium and other EU countries, enable members to restrict immigration to those who can support themselves or find a job in a limited time period. If Article 50 is withdrawn or a Peoples Vote called, parliament should commit to controlling immigration in this way
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 the then-Prime Minister deemed that implementing these controls would be too expensive despite the fact they're used across the EU with great success.
 
I'm certain there's a majority for remaining in the EU if the UK implements these tougher controls to address many leave voters’ concerns. There is an implementation cost but it'd be far cheaper and less damaging than Brexit.

attributes.action: Add an exemption to the Ivory Bill for the Sikh Kirpan.
attributes.background: Baptised Sikhs are permitted by UK law to carry the ceremonial knife called the Kirpan. Many Kirpans are inherited heirlooms & most historic, antique versions contain ivory handles. We want exemption for Sikhs to be able to carry previously, legally purchased antique Kirpans under the new ivory law.
attributes.additional_details: We do not support the trade in ivory, we are only requesting protection & continued freedom of use of any antique Kirpan legally owned before the new ivory law comes into action. As mentioned, historic Kirpans could contain more than 10% ivory. As many practicing Sikhs will continue to travel abroad, we are very concerned that the Kirpan, if constructed of ivory may be confiscated or destroyed. We request that suitable exemptions are put in place to avoid disruption to the Sikh community.

attributes.action: Make kicking people in the head result in a charge of attempted murder.
attributes.background:
Very recently my Neice was attacked by 3 people.
During this attack she was punched and kicked in the head and had her head stomped on I'M CALLING FOR A CHANGE IN LAW that anyone found beyond reasonable doubt to have kicked anyone in the head should be charged with attempted murder.
attributes.additional_details: No one knows what damage you can cause by kicking someone in the head it may just leave a bruise or it may lead to life changing injuries or worse could easily result in death. The attack on my Neice left her unconscious at the side of the road after take 3 kicks to the head and one final stomp, this could have very easily ended in death and should come with a punishment that fits the crime and that will deter people that feel this is acceptable.

attributes.action: Grant Gibraltar special designated status that would keep it within the EU.
attributes.background: Political tensions have risen again over Gibraltar's status since Brexit, & without a credible answer, we could see their people suffer the consequences of leaving the EU worse than any other place in the UK's jurisdiction.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/gibraltar-brexit-northern-ireland-border-spain-theresa-may-a8234516.html
 
http://uk.businessinsider.com/why-the-tiny-territory-of-gibraltar-could-be-the-next-sticking-point-in-brexit-negotiations-2018-6
 
http://www.gibraltarolivepress.com/2016/09/12/chief-minister-fabian-picardo-says-british-means-british-at-national-day-political-rally/

attributes.action: Lower the age for breast cancer screening and make it more frequent
attributes.background:
My mum was diagnosed with Breast cancer after a routine screening which showed a 50p size lump in the middle of her breast. 
My mum was diagnosed with stage 4 terminal cancer that had spread to her liver and lungs. She later passed away.
If I can help anyone it’s worth a try
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 454,000 cases of breast cancer every year in the UK and 1 in 8 people are likely to contract the disease in their life. 
If we can find it early we can not only save peoples lives but save the NHS money

attributes.action: Do NOT introduce the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' to the UK. Decriminalise instead!
attributes.background: The proposed implementation in the UK of the 'Nordic (Swedish) Model' in regards to sex buyer laws criminalises the client and not the sex worker. However, this criminalisation punishes the sex worker by abolishing their market and source of income, whilst making trafficked women harder to find.
attributes.additional_details: Sex workers and women who are forced to sell sex are two separate groups.Yet the Nordic Model assumes that the act of buying sex is inherently violent towards women,this is wrong.Currently for sex workers it's (and should always be),the individual's choice who to have sex with and/or charge for sex. A separate market exists for trafficked women & children and a blanket ban won't help. http://theconversation.com/the-nordic-model-of-prostitution-law-is-a-myth-21351

attributes.action: Make the Be Kind Campaign mandatory at all schools in England
attributes.background: Bullying is a range of behaviours including verbal abuse, physical, emotional, cyber and online bulling. We are seeing children as young as 10 years old killing themselves because teachers are not listening to them or safeguarding them. This Campaign could help children get the support they need.
attributes.additional_details:
In July 2018 I did my first column for the Express & Star newspaper stating that all schools should join and support the Be Kind Campaign
 
Since then I have had several people contact me with regard to the experience their child has had with bullying at school. It's now time to make a change and be that change, for the sake of our children.
 
https://www.expressandstar.com/news/voices/opinions/talking-point/2018/07/19/all-schools-should-join-the-be-kind-campaign/

attributes.action: Repeal legislation allowing access to patients' notes without their consent
attributes.background: NHSE & CQC have recently had acts passed or amended in order to gain access to patients private records, without patient consent being sought. I believe this is in contravention to parts of the Human Rights Act. I’m a GP, and I’m fighting for my patients’ rights to privacy and confidentiality.

attributes.action: Please protect our treasured St Helens beach huts with Listed Structure status.
attributes.background:
8 October 2018 Isle of Wight County Press article "The Isle of Wight's historic railway carriage beach huts at centre of redevelopment discussions" http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16967980.the-isle-of-wights-historic-railway-carriage-beach-huts-at-centre-of-redevelopment-discussions/
 Save our beach!
attributes.additional_details: The beach huts alongside St Helens beach are old railway carriages and part of our national heritage. They deserve to be preserved and conserved against the whims and fancies of developers. Why should we have to destroy our village life to suit the tastes of developers? These beach huts are part of the "setting" of St Helens Fort, a scheduled monument and Listed Building Grade II. As such this should be considered as part of the Historic Environment and be properly protected by the Government.

attributes.action: Longer sentences for sex offenders
attributes.background: Sex offenders and online groomers are getting away with suspended sentences far too often and severely low custodial time. The sentences given need to increase to reflect the severity of these crimes which carry a life sentence for the victims.

attributes.action: Stop rail strikes by legislating!
attributes.background: For too long the RMT has caused misery to the daily lives of millions of people up and down the country! For the good of the country, especially during this turbulent time of BREXIT, this needs to STOP!
attributes.additional_details: https://michaelbradleysblog.wordpress.com/2018/10/26/why-are-the-rmt-striking/

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Protect Women. Make IVF Safer. Amend IVF Law.
attributes.background:
At 25, high dosages of IVF drugs led me to have a heart attack. I am not alone. Last year around 3,700 women undergoing IVF suffered from Ovarian Hyper Stimulation Syndrome. 
That’s why I want an explicit commitment to women’s welfare added to the Human Fertilisation & Embryology Act.
attributes.additional_details:
Protecting the welfare of women undergoing IVF treatment is absent in the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act. Consequently, the Human Fertilisation Embryology Authority (HFEA) is unable to monitor or regulate guidelines on clinical practices relating to the administration of drugs and dosages during IVF. This is why this petition is asking for the Act to be amended. 

Together, let’s make this process safer. Please sign and share this petition with your friends and colleagues. Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of coyote fur
attributes.background: Coyotes are made to suffer for days awaiting to be killed for the use of their fur on coats! A store in Regent street opened with protests but it is still on going! Companies should use faux fur. Protect animals!

attributes.action: Change Government Policy that allows Developers to destroy our Countryside
attributes.background: The current National Planning Framework Policy which dictates the requirements for housing development in the UK means developers have been given the power to force LA's to offer up a minimum of 5 yrs land supply for development putting immense pressure to offer up normally protected Greenbelt
attributes.additional_details: The 5yr land supply makes no allowance for sites that have been given approval but have yet to be developed, ie if the annual requirement for houses in a particular borough, set by government is 1000/yr, the LA must continually find sites to maintain a min. stock of 5000, regardless of whether the developers decide to build or not due to economic or other factors. Developers use this policy to build land stocks while our villages, countryside & greenbelt are being destroyed for profit/greed

attributes.action: A Public Inquiry into the Management and Governance of the UK's Universities
attributes.background: 2017/18 saw the longest university strike ever, over slashed pensions. Students lost classes,  staff  pay.  An independent Joint Expert Panel has found small tweaks, as suggested by staff, would save the pension scheme. The strike was only due to university bosses' insistence on confrontation.
attributes.additional_details:
UK university Vice Chancellors get mega-salaries.  Many unis now employ more administrators and managers than lecturers and researchers.  There is a massive secret network of lobby groups/ consultancies.  This superstructure is all funded by the debt enforced on our children as student loans, and taxpayer’s money. Yet the expert panel's findings suggest it is not up to the job.

A Public Inquiry is need to restore good teaching and research for the public good in Britain's Universities.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT and explore alternatives to business rates across the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Owner of Michelin-starred restaurant Pied-à-Terre, David Moore, wants action to be taken to save businesses and jobs with a thorough review of a sales tax as an alternative to business rates and a reduction on VAT for food sales.
attributes.additional_details: The restaurant businesses on the High Street which employ hundreds of thousands of people in the UK are trying to support their families all over the country and need urgent help to survive.

attributes.action: National Government to decide planning applications for land sold by councils
attributes.background: Local councils hold and own lots of land. If they choose to sell this land it is in the councils best interests to pass any planning application applied for on the land. Once the planning application is approved the council will benefit from the sale. There is a conflict of interest that must cease.
attributes.additional_details: Stafford Borough Council (SBC) are selling a large piece of land at Tilling Drive in Stone Staffs for a lot of money, subject to planning permission. It is therefore in SBC's interest to approve planning consent on this land. It is wrong for a council selling land to also give permission to develop the land. I believe a conflict of interest exists. In such circumstances a government body should manage any planning application to ensure true open and honest government. All ambiguities should be removed from the process and due diligence applied.

attributes.action: Ban school uniforms
attributes.background: People encourage you to express yourselves yet you can't when trapped in expensive and useless uniform
attributes.additional_details: You only wear school uniform for approximately 30/720 hours a week! You pay so much money and hardly wear it also you are often restricted to looking plain (you hardly can wear jewellery makeup or have your hair dyed). The schools often encourage you to 'express yourselves' yet we are trapped in a plain and boring uniform. We have good enough clothes and rules as to what you can wear can easily be introduced if we remove school uniform. There is no point wasting money on uneeded extra clothes.

attributes.action: Introduce Indian Military History to the primary and secondary curriculum
attributes.background: At present, school children from the ages of 4 to 16, are not taught about the commonwealth contribution of soldiers in the British Army, in particular soldiers of Indian descent. Teaching children about their heritage, culture and religions is vitally important and much needed.
attributes.additional_details: Our current project Journey from Home, demonstrates that education on Indian Military history is much needed in the school curriculum. Community interest companies, like myself, have been working with young people to educate and connect them to their history, heritage and culture. Young people have been leading this project and are wanting to know more as they have not been taught about this subject in schools.

attributes.action: Add March 29th to the occasions fireworks are allowed until 1AM
attributes.background: Brexit day must rank at least as high as New Year’s Eve for a celebration.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to reconsider its proposed marketing restrictions for P2P lenders
attributes.background: The recent proposed changes contained within the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)'s consultation on peer-to-peer lenders proposes that obstacles be placed in the way of investor involvement, unless investors can prove they are sophisticated, a HNW, a professional or under professional advisement.
attributes.additional_details:
Peer-to-peer lending was always meant to embody the idea that the old financial order was fundamentally not fit for purpose and needed renewal. For example if banks didn’t pass on interest rate rises to savers, online lenders would. And they have. 
The FCA should rethink its approach and trust the investor to make the right decision about what they do with their investments. Better regulation of peer to peer lending is required but narrowing down choice isn’t the right way to go.

attributes.action: Mandatory custodial sentences for people who attack public sector workers
attributes.background: Just recently a number of attacks or assaults have been made on our public sector workers i.e. Policemen and women. Firemen and ambulance workers, this is not acceptable as those people are doing a job for the public and should be supported not attacked for no reason at all.
attributes.additional_details: Recently perpetrators of attacks on our public sector workers who do vital work in ensuring the safety of the public have been let off with fines and community work by Judges who do not live in the real world we call on the government to give sentences of up to 10 years for assault resulting in the injury of public sector workers, people who carry out these attacks should also be made to pay compensation to the victims.

attributes.action: Stop HMRC from referring to the UK taxpayers as their "customers"
attributes.background: HMRC, in all their publications as well as communications to individuals refers to us, the body of the Great British tax payer as "customers". This is not only misleading, but an outright mockery given the absence of choice over who and what you as a "customer" deal with.
attributes.additional_details: A customer is an individual or business that purchases the goods or services produced by a business. Attracting customers is the primary goal of most public-facing businesses, because it is the customer who creates demand for goods and services." The UK taxpayer does not create a demand for HMRC, nor do we have a choice or any consumer rights when it comes to dealing with HMRC. Therefore, HMRC must revert to using the term "taxpayer" in all their publications and communications.

attributes.action: Not pay foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons
attributes.background: If a country possess nuclear weapons it is in no need of British charity. Donating foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons is a slap in the face of British tax payers.

attributes.action: Produce a strategy to stop Local Bank Branch Closures Nationally
attributes.background: Communities throughout the Country are being left without any of the major banks. This needs to be debated in Parliament with a view to processes being in place to offer alternatives which offer the equivalent services that a major bank does. Post Offices do not offer the same level of service.
attributes.additional_details:
Pateley Bridge North Yorkshire are being left without a bank following the announcement that Barclays Bank will be closing. 
Other bank closures announced in Yorkshire include Knaresborough, Boroughbridge, Grassington, Hawes, all in May 19. 
It is recognised that High Streets lose approx 20% of their trade when people are no longer able to use their bank. The High Street decline nationally can partly be attributed to banks abandoning their customers in a community. 
Online banking is not the answer

attributes.action: More Restrictions on knives up to 25+
attributes.background: Knife crime is getting disturbingly out of hand. Dangerous knives are too easily accessible via parents' kitchens and supermarkets. Parents of teenagers need to lock these knives in a safe or coded cabinet. Supermarkets and shops should have age restriction changed from 18 to 25.
attributes.additional_details: When dealing with this issue the Police are only increasing stop and searches and are not getting to the source of the matter, which is where they are gaining access to the knives – kitchens and shops.

attributes.action: Ensure, where possible government contracts are awarded to UK companies
attributes.background: It is common for local and central government contracts to be given to overseas companies thus compromising jobs for UK people.  These contracts should be given to UK companies employing UK people whenever possible.
attributes.additional_details: For example Sheffield's supertrams are being built in Spain https://www.railjournal.com/passenger/light-rail/vossloh-despatches-first-sheffield-tram-train/

attributes.action: Introduce a plastic deposit return scheme in major supermarkets
attributes.background: The Government must work with supermarkets to introduce a plastic bottle return scheme. Almost 36 million plastic bottles are bought every day in the UK. Less than half are recycled. 35 countries use this scheme, with Norway recycling 96% of their plastic (Sky Ocean Rescue, 2018).
attributes.additional_details: Plastic now ends up in our foods and this is dangerous to us. If other countries can do it then so can we! Floating plastic becomes brittle in sunlight and then slowly breaks up into ever-smaller pieces as it is churned up by waves. It can take centuries to break down. Many scientists believe plastic never completely disappears - particularly if it's submerged in deep or cold water. A drink bottle can take 450 years to break down, while a plastic fishing line could last for 600 years. (Sky Ocean Rescue, 2018)

attributes.action: Legislate the recycling of garden plastic pots for new Taupe coloured pots 2019
attributes.background: Garden centres and retailers have worked together with producers and growers to create a new recyclable plant pot which will be coloured taupe for identification (most current black/brown pots are not recyclable) however 87% of local authorities are not accepting this new taupe coloured pot.
attributes.additional_details: RECOUP have more information. http://www.recoup.org/

attributes.action: Allow HRT to be prescribed free of charge.
attributes.background: We have an aging workforce and women are now working through the Menopause which is not a life choice or self inflicted. HRT is a lifeline to many, allowing them to remain in employment. Despite working many struggle financially so receiving HRT free of charge would help the women and the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Baroness Altham published a report on women in the workforce and stated older women (aged 50 to 64) are now more likely to be in employment with the proportion of those in jobs reaching a record high in 2015 of 64.2% compared to just 41.9% in 1985.
Menopause usually starts between 45 and 55 so many women  are trying to remain in work while dealing with Menopause symptoms that can be  disabling. For many HRT allows them to remain productive and reduces the risk of various other health conditions.

attributes.action: Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field to be used when selling bicycles on web sites.
attributes.background: Many stolen bicycles are sold on second hand web sites. It is almost impossible to identify bikes on these sites. Therefore a Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field must be filled in when selling bicycles on these sites, without the number being given the item cant be advertised e.g. Ebay Gumtree etc.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to knowingly or recklessly mislead Parliament
attributes.background:
The operation of our democracy requires the electorate to be able to place trust in statements made by the Government and its ministers. 

Deception has no place in public life but is increasingly used as a means to an end.

Our Parliament must not become a post-truth institution.

attributes.action: Make private holiday companies who also provide care, be registered with the CQC
attributes.background: There are far too many private holiday providers who are providing care, as part of a packaged holiday to vulnerable adults with learning disabilities, autism and other disabilities They are unregistered and therefore unregulated by the Care Quality Commission and are charging for the care provided.

attributes.action: Include black role models as part of history education throughout the year.
attributes.background: Black history is not a compulsory part of UK education – we are asking the government to look at the positive impact of including important black role models as part of history education throughout the academic year.

attributes.action: Remove the Sudanese Embassador from the UK
attributes.background: Killing protesters must stop. The Sudanese government is not responding to any call, therefore, an international deplomatic pressure must start immediately. We are asking for the removal of Sudanese embassador from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Sudan is currently experiencing a severe economic crisis which has led to a rise in the cost of fuel, electricity, transport, food and medicine provoking countrywide protests. Since 14 December, tens of thousands of people have been taking part in protests in different parts of the country. Security officers use lethal forces at protestors to disperse them killing 37 so far. The government has also shut down the internet since 20 December, in yet another attempt to stop the protests. (Amnesty)

attributes.action: Discuss the mental health issues in Calderdale after increase in suicides
attributes.background: Due to recent suicides there are clearly issues in Calderdale with mental health. This needs to be reviewed to stop more people from taking their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Whether this is to look at putting a net around the bridge or increasing funding and looking at waiting times in this area, the people of Halifax need to know something is been done! 
Please sign.

attributes.action: Make All Disabled Toilets Air Freshener Free - Some Disabilities are Invisible
attributes.background: Please support me in making disabled toilets accessible for those individuals with invisible disabilities or who may be allergic to air fresheners.  These are used in most public toilets including those in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally suffer from a form of Dysautonomia and have to wear a special mask when I use a public toilet, this can be uncomfortable and unfortunately often attracts unwanted attention.
I feel it is important to get recognition that having these electronic devices fitted in disabled toilets or using a can of air freshener in place of it, puts many people at risk. A risk that no one should have to take!

attributes.action: Develop an Isle Of Wight Airport for potential Commercial Airline use
attributes.background:
The Isle Of Wight is in the unfortunate position of having very expensive and unreliable ferries as the only way to get to and from it at present.
This is why it really needs a developed airport to be served by Ryanair, Easyjet etc to give everyone another option to get to and from the Island.
attributes.additional_details:
The Channel Islands which are smaller and have fewer events and far fewer tourists have the option of flights or ferries.

The Isle Of Skye has a fixed link or ferries as options.
It really doesn't feel that the Isle Of Wight's population or visitors are given the support that the aforementioned Islands receive with regards to options of transport to and from the Island at a fair price. We are held to ransom by the ferry companies as that's the only option we have available to us.

attributes.action: Government: honour your manifesto pledge to plant 11m trees by 2020
attributes.background: You won the election with a promise to plant 11million trees by 2020. You must action this and report bi-annually on progress with measures in place to ensure this is met.
attributes.additional_details: Governments must honour their manifesto pledges. Climate change is upon us and biodiversity loss is unprecedented. This government must be held to account on environmental protection & lack of tangible action on their tree planting pledge. Trees take years to grow, they need a management plan and funds to support their maturation. The Government should deliver their promise on time or provide funding to ensure that a suitable charity can take ownership of this action.

attributes.action: Allow UK citizens abroad right to vote and UK residents a Referendum vote
attributes.background:
1 All UK citizens living abroad should be allowed to vote in any electoral & referendum vote, as any other civilised country allows. This is an undeniable citizenship right

2 Any UK resident should be allowed right to vote in any referendum, as is the case with commonwealth citizens and Maltese

attributes.action: A holder of a full UK driving licence can pay to remove minor penalty points
attributes.background: To submit a change in the law where a holder of a full uk driving licence can pay £100.00 per penalty point to remove minor diving penalty points from his/her licence after a period of 6 months from the offence with the proceeds going back in to road safety, education or transportation links.
attributes.additional_details: The Uk driving licence has not been reviewed since 1988 and since this time technology has moved on as well as the public travelling more and for longer distances which means a greater risk of accumulating points of a shorter period of time which will in turn creates financial hardship and damage to the economy for many who rely on motor vehicles in the UK, The money from this change can be used to be spent on road safety and education or better transportation links.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for online platforms to allow sales of CITES-protected species
attributes.background: While it's illegal to buy and sell seahorses (dead, alive, whole or in part) within Europe, online platforms flout this law by hosting adverts for their sale. Seahorses could therefore be functionally extinct in 25 - 30 years* (based on 150 million + seahorses per year taken from the sea).
attributes.additional_details:
Ref: * figures from SaveourSeahorses
 
The Seahorse Trust (www.theseahorsetrust.org) has campaigned and highlighted to each online marketplace over the last twelve + months the illegality of sales of CITES-protected seahorses, but is continually ignored. It should be illegal for these adverts to be hosted by online marketplaces.
